definition: to give shelter from the wind and rain/to keep out the elements
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Love is the willingness to be someone's haven against wind and rain in his or her struggle with life.
sentences.chinese: 愛是願意成爲對方迎戰人生，遮風避雨的安全港。

sentences.english: They needed a place to stay, and they worked their way into our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他們需要一個遮風避雨的地方，同時打動了我們的心。

sentences.english: Or is happiness simply having a roof over your head?
sentences.chinese: 或者，幸福其實很簡單一一有遮風避雨的住所？

sentences.english: May you always find shelter from any storm.
sentences.chinese: 可你總能找到任何遮風避雨。

sentences.english: No place offered shelter all the long way down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 整個下山的路上都沒有遮風避雨的地方。
